title: San Diego/Mission Beach-Pacific Beach
name: Belmont Park
hours: Open April-December, hours vary by season and day of week; typically 11AM-8PM
price: General admission free, ride tickets $1 each (''rides take anywhere from 2-6 tickets each'')
content: A seaside amusement park located near the southern end of Mission Beach, Belmont Park is a landmark with a number of shops, restaurants, an arcade, and a bunch of rides. The big attraction is the '''[http://www.giantdipper.com/index.html Giant Dipper]''', a historic roller coaster that is one of the only two remaining oceanfront roller coasters still operating on the west coast. Also popular is '''The Plunge''', a historic indoor heated swimming pool that continues to be the city's largest indoor pool. Among the other rides is a FlowRider (a simulated wave attraction which you can bodyboard on), an antique carousel, bumper cars, slides, pendulum rides, tilt-a-whirl, and a trampoline.
